main.name: Pareesh Madan

main.bio: I have always been fascinated with the boundless and infinite capabilities of computers which motivated me to pursue a future in Computer Science. Currently pursing internship oppurtunities for Winter 2026.

education.degree: Bachelor of Computer Science, Business Data Analytics Minor (Co-op)
education.description: Relevant Courses: OOP, Data Structures, Software System Development & Integration, Operating Systems

work.title: Software Engineer Co-op
work.description: During Summer 2025, I completed a co-op work term at CIBC as a Software Engineer Co-op in Toronto, Ontario. My role focused on developing internal tools for the Digital Banking team, collaborating with designers and developers to deliver solutions that improved operational efficiency.
work.description2: CIBC (Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce) is one of Canadaâ€™s largest banks, known for its innovative digital banking solutions and commitment to technology. My goals for this term included improving my React.js skills, learning about cloud deployment (AWS), and understanding enterprise-level software development. I successfully improved my React.js skills and learned the basics of AWS deployment, though I was less involved in backend development than I hoped. I worked on a web-based dashboard for internal analytics, requiring knowledge of JavaScript, React, and REST APIs, which I learned both in class and on the job. This work term strengthened my technical and professional skills and gave me insight into large-scale software projects in the financial sector. Special thanks to my supervisor and the Digital Banking team for their support and guidance.

work.title: Software Developer Intern
work.description: Developed a prototype neural network using TensorFlow for image classification to detect diseases in cow lymph nodes, trained on a dataset of over 3,500 annotated DICOM-formatted X-ray images.
work.description2: Designed and implemented a Python-based image format converter program, streamlining the preprocessing of DICOM images for training the neural network.
